Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Digital
Marketing Specialist
BrightPath Kids is one of Canada’s largest childcare providers. We currently have over 78+ childcare centres across Ontario, Alberta, British Columbia and we are still growing. Our childhood educators build a caring & nurturing relationship with each child to provide a high-quality childcare. We are always looking to add talented, energetic, positive, honest, and fun people to our team.
BrightPath Kids Corp is looking to add a talented and dedicated Digital Marketing Specialist.
The Digital Marketing Specialist will work with the marketing team by:
Expert in social media advertisement - Facebook, Youtube, and Instagram
Manage PPC campaigns across Google Adwords for multiple brands - Search and Display
Regular website maintenance (WordPress): update and format content, create new pages/microsites/landing pages, monitor website for performance and updates
Knowledge of using software such as SEMrush, Moz, Majestic, Raven tools, etc
Experience in managing Google tools like Google Analytics, Data Studio, Google Tag Manager, etc
Create weekly and monthly reporting dashboards to update management on the metrics for all performance platforms and draw actionable insights.
Analyze campaigns and translate data into recommendations and plans for revising the campaigns and optimize to improve KPIs on an ongoing basis.
Execute and manage the company’s email marketing, online advertising, and social media initiatives through HubSpot or similar CRM marketing suites.
Monitor effectiveness of digital marketing initiatives through marketing analytics and optimize channel marketing budgets, present marketing outcomes to the management
Assist in developing marketing strategies, in alignment with the company’s revenue strategy, target customer segment and the marketing budget
Assist in conceptualizing marketing campaigns including deciding on specific target segments, optimizing content and spends across various channels
Ability to write SEO friendly blog posts
*
Required Education, Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or equivalent experience
Must have 3+ years’ experience in online advertising (Google ads & Facebook ads) and agency experience is a plus
Able to work independently and in a team; managing multiple priorities and deadlines
Excellent communication skills – oral and written
Experience using Photoshop or other graphic software
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Excellent people skills within internal and external environments
Superb attention to detail, as well as organizational and multitasking skills and ability to work to deadlines
Our team members enjoy:
A competitive compensation package, including group benefits and paid sick leave;
A 40 % discount on childcare;
A Tuition Reimbursement Program to support and encourage professional growth;
Ongoing training and development and great career opportunities.
Join the BrightPath team today!
…the Journey begins here.
We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for interview will be selected.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Dental care
Extended health care
Paid time off
Store discount
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Ability to commute/relocate:
Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)
Application question(s):
Are you legally able to work in Canada?
Experience:
Digital marketing: 2 years (preferred)
Google Ad Manager: 1 year (preferred)
Google Analytics: 1 year (preferred)
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Amazon Marketing Specialist - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Mysa has a progressive company culture that embraces both work-life balance and remote work. The silver lining of the COVID-19 pandemic, if we are to look for one, is that we've been positioned from a company-wide perspective to learn exactly what it takes to successfully manage a remote team - and, we're very proud of what we've achieved. With our core values at heart, we have an in-depth understanding of how imperative it is that all of our people, no matter where they are located, experience our culture and family-like environment in the same manner. We also appreciate that the key to successful remote work is a foundation built upon effective communication, team-based collaboration, and access to all of the right tools. At Mysa, regardless of your location, you will be positioned for success.
Say hello to the Mysa team! The grass really is greener over here. Why? Most importantly, we’ve built a company that’s based on a people-first culture. We encourage (like, really encourage) work-life flexibility, and we’re all about employee recognition. We believe that we do exceptional work when we’re encouraged to play and we’re proud that our team members brag about their jobs to their friends. Of course there’s lots of perks too!
We are looking for an
Amazon Marketing Specialist
to join our
Marketing team
in
St. John's, NL or remotely
. This role is crucial as Amazon accounts for a significant portion of Mysa’s revenue and is an important product discovery mechanism for many of our prospective customers.
What You Will Do:
Setting up and maintaining SKUs and listings on Amazon
Working with the creative team to ensure our Amazon listings represent the Mysa brand, drive conversion and minimize returns
Defining success measures for the Amazon channel per product, reporting against them and taking action based on insights
Staying up to date on all changes to the Amazon platform, including marketing levers and regulations
Identify and implement marketing campaigns and tactics that drive traffic and conversion for all products on Amazon
Monitor FBA seller account health and implement necessary improvements
Monitor Amazon reviews, communicate important trends and identify measures to drive higher volumes of favourable reviews
Ensuring the E-commerce, Commercial Planning and Marketing teams are aware of important cross-channel impacts
Working with Commercial Planning on sales forecasting per product per channel
Working with Project Execution teams on new product launches, timelines and requirements
Who You Are:
Successfully completed Bachelor’s Degree
2+ years of experience with online media in an ad operations/ad traffic role
Experience in growing Amazon revenue
Experience with Amazon Vendor Central and Amazon Advertising
Familiarity with Amazon business metrics
Knowledge of a variety of the financial and targeting concepts of the online advertising industry including but not limited to CPC, CPM, CPA
Previous experience with video file/formats or implementing video campaigns would be an asset
Excellent written/verbal interpersonal skills
Strong attention to detail with the ability to juggle various creative elements and organize campaign setup, ad/creative trafficking, troubleshooting and QA
Analytical, tactical, and a detail-oriented self-starter
Must be able to multitask in a fast-paced environment
Strong team player with accountability and able to work in a highly collaborative environment
You have a passion for marketing - you stay up to date on the industry, platforms, and changes as they roll out
Mysa’s Story
Since entering the market in 2018, Mysa Smart Thermostats have been warmly welcomed into customers’ homes, earning thousands of 5-star reviews.
Our mission is to fight climate change! As the premier Canadian-designed smart thermostats for heating and cooling, Mysa creates thoughtful, innovative technology to help our family of customers across North America stay comfortable and save money by using home energy more efficiently. To help us build a greener, more sustainable future, we’re creating an ecosystem of energy-saving smart thermostats and fostering a unique, people-first company culture that brings out the very best in our team.
What we have to offer you:
A rewarding career path where you can sharpen your skills and showcase your talent
An environment where you are recognized and appreciated for your work and effort
- Unlimited Paid Time Off (Yes. Unlimited paid vacation - within reason of course!)
Flexible environment (Work from home or a coffee shop as you see fit)
Flexible hours (No set “office hours”; You work 40 hrs/wk, and meet your role requirements)
Training & Development Allowance Program
Health & Wellness Allowance ProgramCompetitive salary
Annual salary increases Employee Stock Option Purchase Plan
Comprehensive Group Health, Dental & Vision Benefit Plan
Employer Matching Group RRSP Program
Maternity & Parental Leave Top-Up Program
Quarterly team building initiatives
Allowance for a new pair of high quality sound reducing headphones
Credit towards a smart home product purchase and a free Mysa Thermostat for your home
At Mysa, we believe people are the heart of our business – and we appreciate each individual’s unique qualities and diverse experiences. So, if this role sounds exciting to you, and you fit most of the criteria, do not hesitate to apply - we value individual abilities over a profile on paper.

Title: Specialist, Digital Direct Marketing - Vaughan, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description:
Specialist, Digital Direct Marketing
Permanent Full Time position
Mackenzie Health Foundation supports Mackenzie Health’s vision and mission to deliver the ultimate health experience and to relentlessly improve care through the funding of capital projects, medical equipment, technology and educational opportunities for Mackenzie Health. The Foundation is currently spearheading a $250-million fundraising campaign – the largest ever for a community hospital in Canada – to advance patient care at Mackenzie Richmond Hill Hospital and raise the community portion of funding to build and equip the new state-of-the-art Cortellucci Vaughan Hospital.
Reporting to the Director, Annual Giving & Signature Events, the Specialist, Digital Direct Marketing, plans, designs, implements and evaluates components of the Foundation’s comprehensive digital fundraisng work for the Annual Giving and 50/50 Community Lottery programs, targetted primarily to renew annual support from donors, physicians, staff and acquire new donors and lottery purchasers from the community. Based out of the Foundation's offices in Vaughan, the Specialist, Digital Direct Marketing, is a pivotal role to help the Annual Giving program become “digital first,” meeting its current fundraising goals and building a steady, growing revenue base well into the future from a variety of digital channels.
What must you have?
Expertise in the development and implementation of targeted digital direct marketing fundraising campaigns including: email marketing (asks/stewardship for Annual Giving/ticket purchases for 50/50 Community Lottery); Digital Donor Recognition Walls; custom donation page URLs; website giving; mobile giving; crowdfunding; and text-to-donate.
The ability to work collaboratively with the Foundation’s Marketing & Communications team to develop and execute: paid social media; Google Search; Google Ads; search engine optimization (SEO); evergreen posts on Mackenzie Health social media channels; website edits; Google Analytics tracking; and content for digital assets.
Superb project management skills to execute all digital direct marketing portfolio marketing initiatives, including critical paths, creative briefs, copy briefs, quotations, data requests and instructions to vendors.
Knowledge and experience using Constant Contact or other similar email deployment tool.
Provide performance-based metrics and reports for all digital direct marketing campaigns.
Demonstrated track record creating and monitoring complex test plans.
Detailed monthly review of spending against budget and ensure accurate and timely accounting and reporting of expenses.
Superior analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex information and communicate it to a variety of audiences.
Subject matter expertise, staying on top of the latest digital fundraising trends and innovative practices.
Ability to foster positive working relationships with colleagues in the Foundation and the hospital, as well as with donors and other key stakeholders.
Experience working with multiple external freelancers, vendors and agencies.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to meet competing deadlines in an organized manner.
The ability to work independently and demonstrate initiative.
A flare for creativity, ambition and collaboration.
Minimum of five (5) years of digital direct marketing experience within an annual giving fundraising program.
Basic knowledge of AKA Raisin is an asset.
Basic knowledge of HTML and programming languages
Basic knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
Proficiency with MS Office Suite.
Minimum college and/or university degree or equivalent.
What else do you bring?
You are a team player who is also self-motivated and works effectively in a fast-paced environment with deadlines and multiple workflows.
You have a demonstrated ability to exercise discretion and good judgment, take initiative and respect the confidentiality of sensitive information and materials.
You fully understand and comply with patient and staff safety policies and procedures that foster a safe and inclusive environment for all.
You demonstrate behaviours consistent with Mackenzie Health’s Commitment to Caring and values – Excellence, Leadership and Empathy.
Preferably, your profile also includes:
Experience working in health care philanthropy or not-for-profit environment.
You may be required to work at any site of Mackenzie Health
FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS:
As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Mackenzie Health's Occupational Health and Safety department.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Concord, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Company
SEI is a family owned and operated company that has been in business for over 40 years. As a company we are committed to providing our clients with outstanding quality, integrity and, value.
The Opportunity
We are currently looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to join in our team.The Digital Marketing Specialist will be responsible for the implementation of the marketing strategic objectives.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Implement digital marketing campaigns, including web, SEO/SEM, email, social media and display advertising to achieve corporate objectives for products and services.
Maintaining our social media presence across all digital channels
Measuring and reporting on the performance of all digital marketing campaigns.
Assists with the development and management of the marketing budget.
Coordinate, track and report on the progress of tasks to Marketing Manager
Coordinate with sales team to create marketing campaigns.
Plans and executes promotional activities including print, electronic media, tradeshow, and direct mail.
Delivers content to LinkedIn, YouTube, email, or direct mail.
Creates mass-mail materials.
Creates brochures and sell sheets.
Creates and distributes customer surveys.
Designs and prepares web ready material
Creates and collects data from website forms
Creates and updates webpages in WordPress
Creates PowerPoint and other presentations and marketing materials to support a consistent image of Sherwood Electromotion Inc. at all times.
Coordinates the development, production, and distribution of promotional and collateral materials to support marketing and sales programs.
Analyzes marketing programs and adjusts strategy and tactics to increase effectiveness.
Provides post-event reports, analysis, and regular status reports to Marketing Manager.
Establishes and ensures consistent corporate image throughout product lines, promotional materials, websites, and events.
Ensure that the brand message is consistent
Required Knowledge, Skill & Abilities:
Ability to conduct and create marketing campaigns.
Solid knowledge of website and social media editing and updating.
Ability to post social media calendar with creativity.
Experience with Email marketing.
Participate in trade shows and create booth marketing materials when needed.
Output ideas in regards to brochure and marketing materials.
Solid Photoshop or graphic design skills.
Superior time management skills, multitasking skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks with minimal supervision are essential.
Ability to work independently is imperative.
Strong command of Microsoft Office applications.
Experience with graphic design programs and Maximizer CRM would be an asset.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Team player and capable of thinking outside the box.
Detail oriented and able to accurately proofread marketing materials.
Gathers and analyzes information skillfully.
Ability to make sound, timely, and accurate judgment while supporting reasoning for decisions.
Excellent writing skills including proper spelling, grammar, and punctuation.
Professional, responsive, and a positive work attitude.
Resourceful, flexible, and well organized.
Able to maintain filing systems and basic databases.
Strong verbal skills and the ability to communicate professionally.
Education and Experience:
Four-year Bachelor’s in Business or Marketing degree required.
5-10 year’s related experience required.
Experience coordinating projects, developing project plans and completing projects on time and on budget.
Rail, Transit and Wind Industry background preferred but not required.
Knowledge of markets served by Sherwood Electromotion Inc. would be an asset.
Experience with PPC advertising; familiarity with interpreting GA reports; ability to manage content in WordPress; working knowledge of Adobe CS tools
Experience with Google Analytics.
Previous experience using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, WordPress
Start your career with Sherwood Electromotion Inc. today and be part of a team that rewards quality and integrity with competitive pay, employee benefits and, profit sharing.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Manager, Marketing and Communications (Lazaridis Institute) - Kitchener, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Date:
Nov 15, 2021
Location:
Kitchener, CA
Company:
Wilfrid Laurier University
Department:
Lazaridis School of Bus. & Econ.
Job Type:
Limited Term
Full-time/Part-time:
Full Time ( >=1249 hrs/year)
Campus:
Kitchener
Reports to:
Manager of Operations, Lazaridis Institute with oversight from the Director of Marketing and Communications for the Lazaridis School
Employee Group:
Management
Application Deadline:
November 29, 2021
Requisition ID:
2791
Wilfrid Laurier University is a leading multi-campus university that excels at educating with purpose. Through its exceptional employees, students, researchers, leaders, and educators, Laurier has built a reputation as a world-class institution known for its rich student experience, academic excellence, and global impact. With a commitment to Indigenization and commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion, Laurier’s thriving community has a place for everyone.
Laurier has more than 19,000 students and 2,100 faculty and staff across campuses in Waterloo and Brantford, as well as locations in Kitchener and Toronto. The university is committed to providing an inclusive workplace and employing a workforce that is reflective of local and national demographics. Our locations are situated on the traditional territories of the Neutral, Anishnawbe, and Haudenosaunee peoples. We recognize the unique heritages of Indigenous peoples and support their intentions to preserve and express their distinctive Indigenous cultures, histories, and knowledge through academic programming and co-curricular activities. Laurier’s Centre for Indigegogy is one example of how Laurier honours Indigenous knowledge.
Position Summary:
The Lazaridis School of Business & Economics develops leaders with skills in management and economics for a rapidly changing and complex global environment. It seeks to advance knowledge and practices in these fields by supporting both theoretical and applied research. Further, the Lazaridis School strives to serve business and its community by fostering mutually beneficial alliances with leaders at local, national, and international levels.
The Lazaridis Institute for the Management of Technology Enterprises is a centre within the Lazaridis School. It empowers emerging technology firms to scale rapidly into globally competitive enterprises. Through its ScaleUp Program, the Institute provides the very best growth-stage Canadian tech companies with the opportunity to work with world-class business leaders, and to build the networks that enable them to find the talent, the market contacts and the risk capital needed to grow. The Institute is co-creating a database designed to support innovators, founders, investors and researchers; and is also committed to capturing knowledge and best practices from its work with the tech ecosystem and with scholars to translate that knowledge into executive education curriculum. Its research arm connects scholars globally, to design, collaborate on, promote and disseminate research on innovation, technology and growth.
The incumbent is responsible for leading the Lazaridis Institute’s marketing and communications team in raising the brand awareness of the Lazaridis Institute locally, provincially, nationally, and internationally. Through various marketing and communication campaigns the incumbent will tell the story of the Lazaridis Institute – including its programs and research. To this end, the incumbent supports both the strategic plan and goals of the Lazaridis Institute. The incumbent works in a collaborative way with their team, the broader Lazaridis School marketing and communications team, Laurier’s Communications, Public Affairs & Marketing department, and external marketing firms.
The incumbent raises the brand awareness of the Lazaridis Institute through:
the development, execution, and reporting of the Lazaridis Institute’s marketing and communications strategy;
the development and oversight of individual comprehensive marketing and communications campaigns in support of the overall strategy;
the development and oversight of professional and impactful media, including, but not limited to, brochures and print media, websites, digital media, social media, videos, media releases and photography;
the development of deep relationships with internal and external partners to strategically advance the brand.
The incumbent reports to the Manager of Operations, Lazaridis Institute with oversight from the Director of Marketing and Communications for the Lazaridis School to ensure brand consistency.
This position is based in the Lazaridis Institute, which is currently located at the Lazaridis Executive Development Centre in Kitchener and requires occasional travel.
Accountabilities:
Marketing and Communications Strategy (Lazaridis Institute)
Develop, implement, maintain, and review a marketing and communications strategy for the Lazaridis Institute.
Collaborate with the Managing Director, Lazaridis Institute, on determining the needs of the Institute in relation to the marketing and communications portfolio.
Collaborate with the Director, Marketing and Communications (Lazaridis School), in brand compliance.
Conduct appropriate market research to continually inform the strategy.
Develop, review, and revise metrics to assess the effectiveness of the marketing and communications strategy and maintain a database to store these metrics for longitudinal reporting.
Develop a research-supported methodology using descriptive statistics to assess the metrics of the marketing and communications strategy.
Develop an action plan to successfully execute the marketing and communications strategy.
Develop the budget to support the marketing and communications strategy.
Determine and locate appropriate resources to support the marketing and communications strategy, including, but not limited to, human resources, financial resources, campus partnerships, and external partnerships.
Monitor the implementation of the marketing and communications strategy and ensure that it continues to both support the strategic plan and meet its objectives. When necessary, realign the marketing and communications strategy accordingly.
Write quarterly reports on the success of the marketing and communications strategy using appropriate multimedia elements and statistics.
Write an annual longitudinal report on the success of the marketing and communications strategy using appropriate multimedia elements and statistics.
Develop presentations tailored to specific audiences to report on the success of the marketing and communications strategy.
Marketing and Communications Campaigns
Empower staff in the development of marketing and communications campaigns that support the overall Lazaridis Institute’s marketing and communications strategy.
Monitor the implementation of campaigns and provide guidance and coaching to professional staff as necessary.
Facilitate relationships with internal and external partners to support these campaigns, including:
Ensuring all campaigns are properly funded;
Ensuring correct procurement procedures are being followed;
Ensuring university policies are being met;
Negotiating competitive rates for external contracts;
Ensuring contracts are properly vetted before commitments are made;
Ensuring contract terms and conditions are being followed; and,
Ensuring external corporate partners are being accountable to the campaign.
Ensure all marketing and communications campaigns align with the strategic goals of the Lazaridis Institute, the Lazaridis School, and Wilfrid Laurier University.
Ensure brand and style compliance and professionalism on all campaign materials.
Ensure all campaigns comply with AODA standards.
Resolve conflicts in an appropriate and positive manner.
Digital Presence and Reputation
Manage the Lazaridis Institute’s digital presence in accordance with Laurier standards on all Institute properties, including but not limited to the web and social media.
Create, execute and manage the Institute’s SEO and SEM strategy.
Ensure all cloud-based services used in the marketing and communications of the Institute are approved through the PSIA process.
Monitor news agencies and social media to track the brand awareness and reputation of the Lazaridis Institute.
Work with the Lazaridis Institute’s leadership team to mitigate any reputational concerns, ensuring the Director of Marketing and Communications for the Lazaridis School is involved if any controversial situations occur.
Collegiality and Professionalism
Participate in Lazaridis Institute as part of the Institute’s leadership team.
Participate in both Lazaridis School general and marketing meetings.
Build and maintain professional relationships with on- and off-campus partners and ensure relevant Laurier and Lazaridis School offices are updated on relationship status of multi-campus partners.
Maintain confidentiality around programs, reports, and budgets.
Maintain a professional appearance and attitude.
Monitor the entrepreneurship ecosystem and corporate marketing campaigns to identify opportunities, best practices, and generate creative ideas.
Stay current on the most recent and relevant legislation, policies, best practices, literature, and software, related to the accountabilities and qualifications of the position.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree with a focus in Marketing, Communications, or equivalent with four to five years of relevant experience showing progressive increases in responsibilities; master’s degree preferred
A passion for storytelling.
Experience working in marketing or communications.
Relevant experience developing marketing and communications campaigns that include research, metrics, and methodology to assess success of the campaign.
Experience developing and writing informative and concise reports using multimedia elements and descriptive statistics.
Leadership experience with managing, inspiring, and coaching professional staff.
Relevant experience in creating and tracking marketing budgets.
Experience successfully engaging and collaborating with partners through strong interpersonal, intercultural, intergenerational, and persuasive communications skills.
Demonstrated experience using Adobe Creative Suite.
Demonstrated experience developing print media following set graphic guidelines.
Superior writing skills for a variety of target audiences using an array of media, including but not limited to press releases, stories, social media posts, google ad words, brochures, and websites
Extensive experience with proofing graphics, videos, and written materials.
Experience organizing and executing interviews and focus groups.
Relevant experience building strong relationships with internal and external partners.
Experience working under pressure with tight timelines to a successful outcome.
The ability to work in an agile environment where priorities regularly change.
The ability to problem-solve under pressure to ensure a successful outcome.
The ability to self-motivate and experience working independently with little supervision.
A collegial personality and experience working within and leading a team.
A love for life-long learning, an understanding of best practices within the field, and experience with independent learning of new skills, theories, and technology.
Experience creating accessible and dynamic documents using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
An understanding of the responsibilities under AODA legislation.
Assets, but not required:
Experience working within a post-secondary environment.
Experience with the tech entrepreneurship ecosystem.
Experience managing staff in a unionized environment.
Compensation:
Position Grade:
MG-2B
Rate of Pay:
$76,423 - $95,529
Hours of Work:
This is a full-time, limited term position until December 2023.The normal hours of work are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday to Friday. Flexibility in hours will be required, including evening and/or weekend work, to ensure both the proper oversight and completion of time sensitive activities.
Wilfrid Laurier University endeavors to fill positions with qualified candidates who have a combination of education, experience, skills and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position while demonstrating Laurier's Employee Success Factors.
Equity, diversity and creating a culture of inclusion are part of Laurier’s core values and central to the Laurier Strategy. Laurier is committed to increasing the diversity of faculty and staff and welcomes applications from candidates who identify as Indigenous, racialized, having disabilities, and from persons of any minority sexual and gender identities. Indigenous candidates who would like to learn more about equity and inclusive programing at Laurier are welcomed to contact the Office of Indigenous Initiatives. Candidates from other equity seeking groups who would like to learn more about equity and inclusive programing at Laurier are welcomed to contact Equity & Accessibility. We have strived to make our application process accessible, however if you require any assistance applying for a position or would like this job posting in an alternative format, please contact Human Resources. Contact information can be found at
careers.wlu.ca/content/How-to-Apply-/
Should you be interested in learning more about this opportunity, please visit
www.wlu.ca/careers
_ for additional information and the online application system. All applications must be submitted online. Please note, a CV and letter of introduction will be required in electronic form._
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Expert PPC Amazon - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Description de Génération eCom
Génération eCom est une référence pour les entreprises du Québec dans le commerce en ligne. Située à Varennes, Génération eCom connaît une forte croissance en raison de son expertise unique et ses services en création, en gestion de boutique en ligne et en consultation. Nos spécialistes accompagnent des entreprises sur Amazon et Alibaba afin de les aider à atteindre de nouvelles possibilités de vente à l’international.
Profil recherché
Nous cherchons une personne qui aime les défis, les boutiques Amazon et qui carbure aux opportunités ! En plus de vouloir apprendre constamment sur le commerce en ligne et qui cherche à évoluer dans une entreprise en pleine croissance. La personne idéale se démarque par les atouts suivants :
- 1 à 2 ans d’expériences en marketing digital
- Expérience PPC Amazon
- Expérience en Google adword
- Savoir-faire des bonnes pratiques eComm;
- Maîtriser les campagnes publicitaires sur les points suivants plateformes; Facebook, Adwords, Pinterest
- Connaissance approfondies en SEO et recherche de mots-clés
- Bonne maitrise de Excel
- Être familier avec les budgets et l’aspect financier de Excel
- Surveiller et suivre les nouvelles tendances pour augmenter le positionnement naturel des produits sur Amazon
- Être doué pour le rôle de conseil et d'analyse
- Aimer travailler seul et en équipe
- Posséder un sens des priorités et une forte autonomie.
- Connaissance de Asana (atout)
- Connaissance de ManyChat, Zon.Tools software (atout)
- Connaître les logiciels suivants; Helium10 and Jungle Scout (asset)
- Être doué pour le rôle conseil et en analyse
- Aimer travailler dans un milieu en constante évolution (Startup)
- Bilinguisme essentiel (parlé et écrit)
Avantages
Télétravail, horaire flexible, équipe dynamique, activités d’équipe, entrainement physique de groupe avec entraineur privé à distance 3 fois par semaine. Tâches axées sur les forces.
Description des tâches
Dans le cadre du Programme Compétences numériques pour les jeunes, Génération eCom est à la recherche d’un expert PPC - Amazon afin de rejoindre notre équipe. La personne choisie exercera un rôle de conseiller auprès des clients. En tant que spécialiste, Son rôle sera de développer des stratégies marketing externe (Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Pinterest, etc.), de planifier et d'optimiser les campagnes publicitaires Amazon (Pay Per Click).
Les tâches sont les suivantes :
- Créer et faire le lancement stratégique de nouveau produit client sur Amazon (PPC et marketing externe);
- Optimiser et monitorer les campagnes des différents comptes Amazon, le tout sur base régulière;
- Superviser les autres campagnes et faire des recommandations au besoin afin de les optimiser;
- Présenter des rapports;
- Analyser les tendances et prendre des décisions en fonction de cette analyse;
- Développer et mettre en action des stratégies de marketing externe;
- Gérer des comptes Amazon et optimiser les performances de chaque boutique;
- Faire des recommandations pour optimiser ces boutiques;
- Travailler étroitement avec les chargés de projets, gestionnaire de compte et le directeur des opérations;
- Analyser les PPC, Choisir des KW, Marketing des boutique Amazon;
- Être habile à résoudre des enjeux techniques sur Amazon ;
- Travailler avec l’outil Asana (formation disponible).
Note :
un certain nombre de journées de formation (rémunérées et obligatoires) en développement des compétences numériques font partie intégrante de l’emploi. Les formations sont offertes à distance.
Le/la candidat.e doit répondre aux critères d'admissibilité ci-dessous :
· Avoir entre 15 et 30 ans au début du stage
· Avoir obtenu un diplôme d’études postsecondaires
· Ne pas avoir participé au Programme CNJ depuis le 1er avril 2020
· Avoir légalement le droit de travailler au Canada
· Être citoyen canadien, résident permanent ou avoir obtenu le statut de réfugié au Canada
· Se considérer comme sous-employés, c’est-à-dire occuper un emploi exigeant un niveau de compétence inférieur au niveau d’éducation atteint, ou occuper un emploi à temps partiel ou être au chômage.
Les personnes intéressées à déposer leur candidature sont invitées à faire parvenir leur curriculum vitae avant le 1 décembre à 16h.
Cette initiative est financée par le gouvernement du Canada
Date de début prévue : 2021-12-01
Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, Permanent
Salaire : 20,00$ à 30,00$ par heure
Avantages :
Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
Horaires flexibles
REER Collectif
Travail à Distance
Horaire :
8 Heures
Du Lundi au Vendredi
Question(s) de présélection:
Avez vous de l'expérience en PPC sur Amazon ? Si oui, précisez.
Télétravail:
Oui

Title: Part Time - Digital Communications and Events Coordinator - startGBC - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Land Acknowledgement
George Brown College is located on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples who have lived here over time. We are grateful to share this land as treaty people who learn, work, and live in the community with each other.
At George Brown College, we have established a reputation for equipping our students with the skills, industry experience and credentials to pursue the careers of their choice. As employees, we are committed to creating an enriching learning community for our students, delivering excellence in what we do, holding ourselves accountable for our work and demonstrating diversity and respect for one another.
What responsibilities will you have in this role?
Support the planning, coordination, execution, hosting/facilitation, and marketing of startGBC events in collaboration with Manager, startGBC and other stakeholders.
Represent startGBC at events either as a facilitator, moderator, presenter, or attendee.
Write, develop, and schedule website, social media and newsletter content for startGBC communication channels.
Maintain databases (CRM, mailing lists and spreadsheets) to ensure accurate extraction of analytical metrics and program participant details.
Communicate and coordinate with startGBC partners, mentors, advisors, funders over participation opportunities and logistics updates.
Actively monitor entrepreneurial eco-system for content that can improve website startGBC user engagement.
Support with quarterly metrics report submission and analyse process for suggestions integrating process improvements.
Attend staff meetings and training as required.
Other related duties as assigned.
What qualifications do you need for this role?
Two year diploma or equivalent from a recognized post-secondary institution in Marketing or Digital Communication and/or equivalent experience or educational background.
One (1) year experience within Digital Communications, Marketing Coordinator, Events, Learning Content Creator or related position.
One year of practical experience in Digital Communications, Community Outreach, Marketing Coordinator, or related position.
Proficiency in the use of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), HubSpot, Hootsuite, WordPress, MailChimp, Eventbrite and Google Analytics.
Knowledge of AODA provincial standards.
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
Confident presenter or moderator or facilitator of events.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to engage with people of all levels and backgrounds.
Demonstrated experience in preparing, updating, and maintaining websites, social media, marketing materials and presentations.
Superior organizational skills for efficient filing, tracking, updating databases, and providing administrative and logistical support.
Proven ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and independently.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and exercise sound judgment.
Strong time management skills are required to effectively prioritize with minimal supervision.
An entrepreneurial mindset to provide intrapreneurial solutions to complex problems.
Positive attitude, flexible working approach and willingness to help out where there is an organizational need.
Demonstrated commitment in delivering excellent service to others as this is key in supporting the success of our students and our College.
Effective ability to interact with others and deal with situations in ways that respect diverse backgrounds, experience and styles.
Flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.
Interview process may consist of a practical skills component.
TO APPLY:
If you are a George Brown College employee, go click
here
to apply via our internal site.
If you are an external candidate, go to
www.georgebrown.ca
and click on the “Employment at George Brown” link or click on the ‘apply’ button to the left of the posted job to apply.
NOTES:
Please ensure your resume highlights all relevant education, training and experience that are applicable to the minimum qualifications for this role.
The College requires proof of degrees, credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post-secondary institutions and/or their international equivalents. Credentials may require validation at the time of interviews.
First consideration will be provided to regular part time (RPT) support staff in accordance with the part time Support Staff Collective Agreement.
Closing: November 26, 2021
George Brown College is committed to creating and sustaining an equitable and inclusive learning and working environment. We encourage and actively seek applications from Indigenous, Black, racialized people, visible minorities, 2SLGBTQIA+ persons, all genders, and persons with disabilities. George Brown College is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources representative responsible for the recruitment for this position will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process. Candidates who require accommodation in the interview process may contact
talentacquisition@georgebrown.ca
and all information received will be addressed confidentially.
As a unionized workplace, we support our internal employees by providing first consideration to qualified applications as set out in the Collective Agreement.
For information on George Brown College, please visit our website at
www.georgebrown.ca
.

Title: Digital Media Specialist - Brampton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job description
We are looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to assist in the planning, execution, and optimization of our online marketing efforts. You will be responsible for setting up, implementing, and managing the overall group company's digital marketing strategies and website development website our subsidiary division
The ideal candidate will have a passion for every aspect of marketing and technology. You will be well-versed in the concepts surrounding digital marketing and how the Internet can become a strong asset to securing growing revenue. You will be tech-savvy and intuitive with great ideas to reinforce our marketing campaign.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide creative ideas for content marketing and update website
Publish online completed book and help monetize using different channels
Implement digital marketing activities across a broad range of digital marketing channels
Plan, initiate and monitor the ongoing company presence on social media
Coordinate the creation of digital content (e.g. website creation for subsidiary business, blogs, press releases, and podcasts)
Digitalize end-to-end company projects
Prepare online newsletters and promotional emails and organize their distribution through various channels
Launch optimized online adverts through Google Adwords, Facebook, Instagram, etc. to increase brand awareness
Be actively involved in SEO efforts (keyword, image optimization, etc.)
Manage and improve online content, considering SEO and Google Analytics
Measure the performance of digital marketing efforts using a variety of Web analytics tools (Google Analytics, WebTrends, etc.)
Acquire insight into online marketing trends and keep strategies up-to-date
Monitor competition and provide suggestions for improvement
Conduct research on market trends, brand’s audiences and competitors, and end-to-end consumer journey to drive engagements and conversions
Stay abreast of emerging digital tools and platforms, digital marketing trends, new technologies, and share insights with the rest of the team
REQUIREMENTS
Proven experience as a Digital Marketing Executive or similar role
Excellent understanding of digital marketing concepts and best practices
Experience with social media, Google Adwords, and Email campaigns
Creative Design ideas
Perfect knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, NetInsight, WebTrends, etc.)
Solid knowledge of Photoshop, Final Cut Pro, Premiere Pro, Audacity, or other media editing software
Experience with visual communication principles
Familiarity with web design and content management systems
Additional qualification in web design or animation is a plus and needed
Skills and experience in creative content writing
Analytical mindset and critical thinking
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
BSc degree in Marketing, Digital technologies or relevant field
Contract length: 3-6 months
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract
Salary: $16.00-$20.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work remotely:
No

Title: Digital Account Executive - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Authority Media
is seeking a dynamic and enthusiastic Account Executive
who is passionate about consumer technology and taking a consultative sales approach to engage brands and agencies. This is a new role with Android Authority, one of the world’s leading media publications covering tech news and product reviews.
We're open to any U.S. or Canadian based candidates.
We’re prioritizing a great team fit more so than the ideal geographic fit.
We’re seeking a motivated individual who can secure deals with brands that would benefit from promotion to our high-intent tech audience. This AE will primarily sell direct campaigns (i.e., display, native, sponsored content). Bottom line - if conducting outreach to and creating advertising solutions with brands like Telus, Verizon, Samsung, and Sony excites you, then you’re a great fit for this role. We’ll arm you with the tools to be successful, and in turn, you’ll identify the right messaging, business needs, and tailored solutions for our brand partners.
You and we understand that nurturing relationships is a process that might require some combination of emails, phone calls, social media, and in-person to create a meaningful connection that moves the ball forward. Being pleasantly persistent and proactive are the keys to success in this role!
This is a mid-level position with lots of opportunities to grow! As you learn and master this role, you’ll have many opportunities that will facilitate your career growth with Authority Media. This position reports to the VP of Strategy & Business Development.
In your role on the Business Development team, you will:
Develop valuable relationships through the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing deals with brands and agencies in an assigned vertical.
Establish Authority Media as a top consideration with brands and agencies for their RFPs, and keep them regularly informed of our product solutions.
Understand how to pull and communicate the right data points to engage a prospect.
Collaboratively work with internal team members to develop marketing materials and proposals that delight and exceed the expectations of our brand partners.
Keep our team informed about customer feedback and data gathered in the field, so that we’re continuously improving our solutions and value proposition.
Use CRM to record progress with accounts and stay organized.
What we are looking for:
Minimum of 3 - 5 years sales experience. Bonus points if this experience has been with a media company and/or with established contacts in the consumer electronics vertical.
Solid understanding of online advertising and the media landscape.
Understanding of the RFP process and the ins-and-outs of preparing a media plan.
Strong familiarity with research tools such as MediaRadar, Winmo, Sales Navigator, SellerCrowd, Quantcast, Comscore, or other similar software.
Comfortable pulling and presenting data from tools such as Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Facebook Ad Manager.
Intellectually curious with a desire to identify the right solutions for potential clients.
Excellent written/verbal communication skills when interacting with brands/agencies whether in an email pitch or presentation (video or in-person).
Highly motivated, driven and self-starting individual who also understands how to be an effective team player (especially with a largely remote team).
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.
Proficiency in Google Docs, Google Sheets, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint required.
Travel requirement (10 - 15% domestic and international) once safe to do so.
Sense of humor, positive attitude, and eagerness to learn!
2r8MIcYOKp

Title: Social Media Advertising Specialist - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
As a Facebook Ads Specialist, you will be responsible for creating high-performing paid campaigns using Facebook/Instagram Ads.
You will have the opportunity to work with multiple clients in a variety of industries. You will be involved in writing ads, testing, scaling, and optimizing them to deliver results.
Your responsibility will be to meet the client’s goals, create campaigns that align with their brand, and follow best practices for Facebook advertising.
The ideal candidate for this position is a Facebook expert who loves writing ad copy, managing campaigns, and creating strategies to help clients reach their marketing goals and ultimately grow their businesses.
Responsibilities
: Create New Strategies  * Create Facebook Ad strategies to achieve client goals  *  * Implement the strategy including campaign setups, copywriting, ad creation, audience creation, Facebook Pixel, and event setup Manage Facebook Ads Campaigns  * Manage Facebook and Instagram Ad strategies for your roster of clients  * Stay current with best practices, strategies, and industry standards related to Facebook and Instagram Ads  * Proactive monitoring and optimization for all client accounts  * Reach key performance targets  * Manage ad spend budgets  * Analyze and report on account performance, and communicate new opportunities  * Overall, your responsibility is to ensure your accounts are running smoothly and reaching your client’s goals Leadership  *
Qualifications
:  * 3+ years of Facebook Ads experience  * Facebook Ads Certification is preferred  * Experience managing a roster of clients and optimizing accounts to improve performance  * Experience creating strategies (including ad spend budgets), implementing and optimizing them to produce results  * Proven skills in ad copywriting  * Creative mindset  * Experience using Facebook Ads and Business Manager  * Strategic mindset with a demonstrated ability to analyze data  * Leadership & problem-solving skills
Bonus Skills & Experience
:  * Experience in the following areas is a bonus (Google Search & Display, YouTube, Pinterest Ads, LinkedIn Ads, TikTok Ads, and Google Analytics)  * Google Ads and Google Analytics certifications  * Experience with landing page development (WordPress and Unbounce).
Job Types: Part-time, Freelance
Pay: From $25.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
TikTik Ads: 1 year (preferred)
Google Ads: 2 years (preferred)
Facebook Advertising: 2 years (required)
Instagram Ads: 2 years (required)
Work remotely:
Yes
